page.title: 12Lois Weedon Village Hall
page.content: {LOIS WEEDON VILLAGE HALL}: originally built for the W.I., was rennovated in 1984 by volunteer helpers. It is now used for a meeting place by all Groups, as well as being the dining hall for the Village School. For the very young there is a Play Group three times a week. The same energy levels are needed by the adults for the Aerobics classes. The general interest in gardening is reflected by the Horticultural Society, Flower and Garden Club and Flower Arranging classes who all have regular meetings here. Flower arranging is of a high standard, with members winning many prizes at Northampton Show in 1985. There is still room on the calendar for Lois Weedon & Weston Women's Ins- titute to hold their monthly meetings, & to shelter the May Day Fete or other Village Occasions in wet weather.
